meanings.definition: To go around in search of amusement or pleasure.
meanings.sent1: On weekends, the children gallivant in the park, playing and laughing.
meanings.sent2: She loves to gallivant through the city, exploring new cafes and shops.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to gallivant around the house, chasing shadows for fun.
meanings.sent4: The butterflies gallivant from flower to flower, spreading joy with their colorful wings.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the friends gallivanted along the beach, enjoying the cool breeze.

meanings.sent1: After finishing his work, he would gallivant around the neighborhood, lost in thought.
meanings.sent2: The dog likes to gallivant in the backyard, sniffing at every corner.
meanings.sent3: The old man would gallivant through the park, reminiscing about his youth.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would gallivant from one idea to another, never settling on a single thought.
meanings.sent5: The clouds gallivant across the sky, changing shapes with the wind.
